chapter.title: Editing points
chapter.para:
editorpoint The point editor allows you to edit fields containing information at scattered locations. Some examples of these would be:
snowfall depth
total precipitation
The point editor controls appear when you choose to edit a scattered point field. Point edit tools

orderedlist.title: To add a point to your depiction:

listitem.para:
Select the Add tool.
Add
Click the spot on your depiction where you want your point to appear.
A dialog box appears for you to fill in the attributes you want to display for this point.
Enter the attributes and click Set Attributes to save the point to your depiction.

Select the Modify tool.
Modify
Pick the point to delete. (see )
Click the &right; mouse button and select Delete.

Select the Move tool.
Move
Pick the point(s) to delete. (see )
Click the &right; mouse button and select Cut.
To restore the line(s), click the &right; mouse button and select Undo or Paste.

sect1.title: Moving a point
sect1.para: point field editormove You can move one or more points on your depiction use the Move tool.

To move a point:
Select the Move tool.
Move
The Move menus appear. (see )
Pick the point(s) to move. (see )
Click the &right; mouse button and select Translate.
The picked points turn blue.
Pick a reference point on the map and hold the &left; mouse button down.
The reference point can be anywhere; however, if you are moving the point(s) off the depiction it is important to pick a reference point that will remain on the depiction after the move. The point(s) attributes shimmer indicating you can now move them.
Drag the point(s) to the new location and release the button.
The &FPA; then recomputes the field and re-displays the new point(s) in white.
Note: The points remain selected until you deselect them, so you may continue to use the Move tools. (see )

sect1.title: Copying a point
sect1.para: point field editorcopy You can copy a point by using Copy and Paste with the Move tool.

listitem.para:
Select the Move tool.
Move
The Move menus appear. (see )
Pick the point(s) to copy. (see )
Click the &right; mouse button and select Copy.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Cancel to deselect all points, or move to another depiction.
Paste is now available.
Note: if pasted to the same depiction the points will be automatically offset to avoid inadvertent duplication.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Paste.
The points remain selected until you deselect them, thus Translate is available in the &right; mouse button context menu. (see )
Note: You can still remove the copied field if you click Undo at this point.

orderedlist.title: To change the attributes of a point using the Modify tool:

listitem.para:
Select the Modify tool.
Modify
The Modify menus appear. (see ) Point modify menus
Pick the point to modify. (see )
Click the &right; mouse button and select Set.
The attribute dialog box appears.
Change the attributes of the point.
Note: Attributes that cannot be changed are greyed out.
Click Set Attributes.

sect1.title: Merging information in a point field
sect1.para: point field editormerge You can bring a field from another source and time and merge it into the depiction using the Merge tool.

listitem.para:
Select the Merge tool.
Merge
The Merge menus appear. (see )
Select the Source, Issue Time and Valid Time of the other field you wish to merge with your current depiction.
Note: Your System Administrator may configure a field to accept merges from another "compatible" field. If this is the case, there will be a Field list in the Merge Fields area.
Click Fetch.
The field information from the other source is laid over top of your depiction.
Pick the point(s) to merge. (see )

Finish your selection by pressing the &right; mouse button and select &colwidth2;
Select...To...
Merge merge information in place
Translate move and merge the information
Note: the picked information remains selected, so you may perform multiple translate operations.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Cancel to complete the merge.

sect1.title: Sampling values from a point field
sect1.para: point field editorsample You can add temporary labels to the &FPA; window with the Sample tool.

listitem.para:
Select the Sample tool.
Sample
The Sample menus appear. (see )
The cursor appears as cross-hairs while inside the map window.
Select the type of sample you want from the Sample Item area.
You can choose to sample All Attributes or a single attribute from the list.
Select the display attributes: colour, size and font.
Pick a point on the depiction.
A temporary label appears.
You can sample as many points as you want.
Note: If you selected All Attributes, a dialog box appears displaying All Attributes for the point.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Clear to clear the samples from the depiction.

sect1.para: Note: if you select All Attributes from the Sample Item area, the Preset Points option cannot be used. Only single attributes can be displayed with this option.
